solution_line_template: She has {num_grandchildren} grandchildren {num_children} children so she needs {num_grandchildren}+{num_children} = <<{num_grandchildren}+{num_children}={total_stockings}>>{total_stockings} stockings

The stockings are ${stocking_price} each and currently {discount_percent*100}% off so that's {stocking_price}*{discount_percent} = $<<{stocking_price}*{discount_percent}={discount_amount}>>{discount_amount} off

The stockings are ${stocking_price} with a ${discount_amount} discount so they are each {stocking_price}-{discount_amount} = $<<{stocking_price}-{discount_amount}={discounted_price}>>{discounted_price}
The stockings are now ${discounted_price} and she needs {total_stockings} so that's $<<{discounted_price}*{total_stockings}={stockings_total}>>{stockings_total}
She also wants to monogram each stocking at ${monogram_price} per stocking so that's {total_stockings}*{monogram_price} = $<<{total_stockings}*{monogram_price}={monogram_total}>>{monogram_total}

The stockings are ${stockings_total} and the monogramming will cost ${monogram_total} so the stockings will cost {stockings_total}+{monogram_total} = $<<{stockings_total}+{monogram_total}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
